more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work
more.description: Conceptual artist Sarah Charlesworth's 1979 study of how newspapers covered a solar eclipse inspired the framework behind The Mutapa Times.

more.title: RBZ governor says still early days to reduce 35% interest rate
more.description: THE Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe (RBZ) has defended its position of maintaining the Bank Policy Rate at 35% arguing that it is still early days to shift it downwards. A bank policy rate or key interest rate is the benchmark interest rate set by a central bank to implement its monetary policy and influence the [...]The post RBZ governor says still early days to reduce 35% interest rate appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Affidavit blunder sinks ex-cop’s court bid to challenge dismissal
more.description: A FORMER Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP) officer’s challenge against dismissal has collapsed after the High Court struck off his opposing affidavit and ruled that his own application was filed too late and had no merit. William Nengwekuru took the Police Service Commission and the Commissioner-General of Police to court, seeking a review of the decision [...]The post Affidavit blunder sinks ex-cop’s court bid to challenge dismissal appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei Killed in US-Israeli Strikes
more.description: TEHRAN, Iran – Iran’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has been killed in a massive joint military operation carried out by the United States and Israel on Saturday, 28 February 2026. The death of the 86-year-old cleric, who ruled Iran with an iron fist for 35 years, marks a pivotal moment in the Middle East, [...]The post Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei Killed in US-Israeli Strikes first appeared on My Zimbabwe News.

more.title: DEATHS AT MANJUZU CEREMONY: Sangoma and well known cellphone dealer die during wealth rituals at Clydesdale Dam
more.description: The usually tranquil waters of Clydesdale Dam in Gweru were shattered earlier this week when two men, a well-known mobile phone dealer and a traditional healer, drowned during a traditional ritual, leaving a group of friends and family utterly devastated. What began as a straightforward ceremony to invoke the water spirits of Clydesdale Dam took [...]The post DEATHS AT MANJUZU CEREMONY: Sangoma and well known cellphone dealer die during wealth rituals at Clydesdale Dam first appeared on My Zimbabwe News.
